title: Define Project Scope and Requirements
description: Clearly outline the requirements for the AI Legal Research Assistant. The system should be capable of performing various types of legal research including case law, statutes, regulations, and administrative decisions. It should access legal data from multiple sources such as legal databases, court records, official gazettes, and legislative sites. The expected outputs are relevant citations, summaries, analyses, and interpretations. Essential features include natural language processing, machine learning, user interface, and API integration. Non-functional requirements involve high performance, scalability, security (data encryption, anonymization, and user authentication), compliance with legal data privacy regulations, and accessibility. Consider edge cases, error handling mechanisms, and performance optimizations. The RFC is ready for the 'REVIEW' state.

title: Design System Architecture
description: Design the overall architecture of the AI Legal Research Assistant, including the components, data flow, interactions between different modules, and integration with external legal databases and APIs. Consider incorporating a microservices architecture for scalability, maintainability, and modularity. Ensure proper error handling, logging, and monitoring mechanisms are in place, and implement these features using best practices such as circuit breakers, retry policies, and distributed tracing. Address security concerns related to handling sensitive legal data and compliance with relevant regulations by following OWASP guidelines and adhering to privacy laws like GDPR and CCPA. To ensure high performance, consider caching strategies for frequently accessed data and optimize data transfer between services.
dependencies: Identify Legal Data Sources and APIs

title: Develop Data Acquisition and Processing Pipeline
description: Implement a pipeline to acquire and process legal data from various sources, such as case law databases, legal journals, and government repositories.

title: Build Natural Language Processing (NLP) Module
description: Develop an NLP module to analyze and understand legal text, including techniques for named entity recognition, relationship extraction, and semantic analysis.

title: Implement Legal Reasoning and Citation Engine
description: Create an engine that can reason over legal concepts, identify relevant case law, and generate citations based on the user's query or legal brief.

title: Develop User Interface and Interaction
description: Design and implement a user-friendly interface that allows users to input legal queries or briefs, and displays the relevant citations and legal analysis generated by the system.

title: Integrate System Components
description: Integrate the various components of the AI Legal Research Assistant, including the data acquisition pipeline, NLP module, legal reasoning engine, and user interface.
dependencies: Develop Data Acquisition and Processing Pipeline
Implement Legal Reasoning and Citation Engine

title: Conduct System Testing and Evaluation
description: Perform comprehensive testing of the AI Legal Research Assistant, including unit tests, integration tests, and end-to-end tests. Evaluate the system's performance, accuracy, and usability.

title: Implement Security and Compliance Measures
description: Ensure the AI Legal Research Assistant adheres to relevant security and compliance standards, including data privacy regulations and ethical guidelines for AI systems.

title: Deploy and Maintain System
description: Deploy the AI Legal Research Assistant to a production environment, and implement processes for monitoring, scaling, and maintaining the system over time.

title: Create Documentation and User Guides
description: Develop comprehensive documentation and user guides for the AI Legal Research Assistant, including installation instructions, usage examples, and API references.
